column2: LOUISIANA DMV PRACTICE TEST
Question Text
1. A vehicle is stopped at a crosswalk to permit a pedestrian to cross the roadway. The driver of the vehicle approaching from the rear should:
column4: overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.
column6: not overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.

column2: 2. Where must a pedestrian walk when there are no sidewalks?
column4: On the side of the road, in the same direction of traffic.
column6: On the left side of the road, behind slower vehicles.
column8: In the middle of the road, facing oncoming traffic.
column10: On the side of the road, facing the traffic.

column2: 3. When meeting a car with blinding headlights, you should:
column4: dim your lights, then speed up and pass quickly.
column6: look toward the right side of the road.
column8: use your emergency flashers to warn the other driver.
column10: look toward the left side of the road.

column2: 4. This sign means:
column4: The road will curve to the right, then to the left.
column8: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column10: Road slippery when wet. Drive slowly.

column2: 5. What does the flashing signal in the picture indicate?
column6: The same thing as a stop sign.
column8: Pedestrians should finish crossing the street if started.
column10: Pedestrians should start crossing the street.

column2: 6. If another car is in danger of hitting you, you should:
7. If your turn signals fail, you should use _____ to indicate your intention to turn.
8. This sign means:
column8: The road to the right is for one-way traffic only
column10: Stay on the main highway if possible

column2: 9. When following motorcycles, drivers should:
column4: keep less space in front of their vehicle.
column6: keep more space in front of their vehicle.
column10: try to pass them as they have different braking capabilities than other motor vehicles.

column2: 10. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they approach a curve on a two-way road and can not see around it.
column6: they can not safely return to the right lane before any oncoming vehicle comes within 200 feet of them.
column8: their lane has a solid yellow center line.

column2: 11. Lanes of traffic moving in the same direction are divided by ____ lines.
12. You are driving and you are feeling drowsy. You should:
column4: turn on the radio to keep you awake.
column6: have a beer or two to keep you awake.
column10: find a safe place to stop for a break.

column2: 13. On average, how long does it take your body to remove the alcohol contained in 5 ounces of wine?
14. Pentagonal signs are used to indicate:
15. If your car starts to skid, turn your steering wheel:
column4: in the direction you want to go.
column6: to keep the front wheels straight.
column8: in the opposite direction of the skid.
column10: in any direction. It doesnt matter.

column2: 16. A flashing red light means:
column4: Go, but yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.
column8: The light will soon change to steady red.
column10: The same as a STOP sign.

column2: 17. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a dip in the road. Drivers should be ready to stop if the dip is filled with water.
column10: a bridge ahead, wide enough to accommodate two lanes of traffic, but with very little clearance.

column2: 18. Two drivers reach an uncontrolled intersection at the same time. Who has the right of way?
column8: The driver who does not control the car.

column2: 19. This road sign means:
column6: Bicycles have the same rights as other vehicles
column8: Bicycles cross or ride beside traffic

column2: 20. When entering a highway from an entrance ramp, drivers should:
column4: drive above the speed of traffic to get ahead.
column6: enter slowly to avoid other vehicles.
column8: accelerate to the speed of traffic.
column10: stop first, then gradually enter traffic.

column2: 21. This road sign means:
22. A speed limit is the __________ speed at which a vehicle may legally travel on the road under ideal conditions.
23. This sign indicates:
24. Which of the following is NOT true about ABS?
column6: It helps increase your stopping distance.

column2: 25. The ‘One Way’ sign means that:
column4: there is only one road that turns left at the intersection.
column6: only vehicles turning left may travel in the direction of the arrow.
column8: drivers may travel only in the direction of the arrow.

column2: 26. This sign warns drivers that:
column8: there is a one lane bridge ahead.
column10: drivers in the left lane have the right-of-way

column2: 27. You face a green light, but traffic on the other side of the intersection does not allow you to travel all the way through the intersection. What must you do?
column6: Enter the intersection and wait until traffic ahead clears.
column8: Wait for the next green light.
column10: Wait until traffic ahead clears, so you do not block the intersection.

column2: 28. Air bags are meant to _________ seat belts.
29. As you drive on the expressway, make sure:
column6: your directional signal goes off before you change lanes.
column8: you cut off vehicles behind you when you change lanes.

column2: 30. Keeping a space cushion between you and the other vehicles around you is important because it:
column4: gives you time to react to situations.
column6: keeps traffic flowing at a safe pace.

column2: 31. This road sign means:
column10: Right turn permitted on red light

column2: 32. What should you do as you prepare to turn right at an intersection?
column4: Signal your turn, check for bicyclists, and do not turn directly in front of a bicyclist.
column6: Yield to bicyclists coming from the opposite direction.

column2: 33. Before backing up, you should:
column4: turn your head and look through the rear window.
column6: get off the car to see if it is clear to proceed.
column10: rely on your mirrors to see if it is clear to proceed.

column2: 34. Which of the following drugs could affect your ability to drive?
35. Your blind spot is the area of the road:
column4: you see in your side mirror.
column6: you cannot see without moving your head.
column10: you see in your rearview mirror.

column2: 36. What does a yellow arrow signal mean?
column4: The same as a green light.
column6: The same as the yellow light, but applies only to movement in the direction of the arrow.
column8: Vehicles moving in all directions must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.

column2: 37. When approaching a highway-rail intersection, the first sign drivers see is usually:
column4: an RXR round sign on a yellow background.

column2: 38. This road sign means:
column4: Trucks have the right of way

column2: 39. When driving at night with no other vehicles ahead, a driver should use:
40. A yellow arrow means:
column4: Do not go in the direction of the arrow.
column6: If you intend to turn in the direction of the arrow, be prepared to stop.
column8: The same as a steady yellow light.
